description:
Sobre a vaga
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently

It‚Äôs Great if you Have:

Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

required_skills: ['Pandas (Software)', 'Atribui√ß√£o de marketing', 'Attribution', 'Ci√™ncia da computa√ß√£o', 'Ci√™ncia de dados', 'Estat√≠stica', 'Gest√£o de or√ßamentos de marketing', 'NumPy', 'Otimiza√ß√£o', 'Seaborn']
description:
Sobre a vaga
We believe that every business should have access to affordable, easy-to-use payment solutions, no matter their size. Back in 2012, SumUp was founded by a small team with one goal in mind ‚Äì to create a world where small business owners can be successful doing what they love. Today, over 4 million businesses rely on SumUp to get paid. What started out as one card reader has now turned into a range of readers, multiple remote payment solutions such as Invoices, Gift Cards, Payment Links and so much more.

As a (Senior) Data Scientist you will be part of our MarTech mission to build a data-powered product roadmap to automate, measure and optimise Marketing activities. You will join a global team that is building foundations and running experiments to acquire customers efficiently.

What you‚Äôll do in this role:

Evolve our multi-touch attribution model, which tells the credit for conversions by marketing channel
Work on predictions and insights that contribute to shaping the direction of the company
Collaborate with an international team spanning 2 continents, made up of engineers, product manager, and marketing specialists
Act as the main Data Scientist expert in the domain, guiding the solutions and supporting team members

You will be great for this position if you have:

A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economy, Computer Science or a comparable degree.
5+ years of experience in data science, and in marketing (marketing budget optimisation, MMM, attribution, bidding automation)
Experience building and deploying machine learning models and algorithms end-to-end at scale
Experience in experimenting and measuring marketing strategies (set up A/B test, lift test or geo test and evaluate it)
Proven experience using Python and its scientific stack (pandas, sklearn, numpy, statsmodels, xgboost, matplotlib, seaborn)
Good communication and visualisation skills in working with non-technical stakeholders
Advance knowledge of SQL
Proven experience working with Cloud Technologies (AWS, Snowflake, Airflow) and CI pipeline (GitHub Actions)
Embrace best practices and have a passion for clean, maintainable and testable code

Why you should join SumUp

We‚Äôre a truly global team of 3000+ people from 60+ countries, spread across 3 continents. We have a close, welcoming and international community
Learning & development budget for attending conferences and training
Health and life insurance
Dental plan (optional)
Our wellness benefits, such as Gympass and Zenklub
Private pension plan
Annual bonus
1 month of sabbatical vacation for every 3 years of SumUp
The opportunity to work on large scale fintech products used by millions of businesses around the world
You'll have the space and support to drive your career

About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we create powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses. With a founder‚Äôs mentality and a 'team-first‚Äô attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

SumUp will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Wabtec Corporation is a leading global provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions and value-added services for freight and transit rail. Drawing on nearly four centuries of collective experience across Wabtec, GE Transportation and Faiveley Transport, the company has unmatched digital expertise, technological innovation, and world-class manufacturing and services, enabling the digital-rail-and-transit ecosystems. Wabtec is focused on performance that drives progress, creating transportation solutions that move and improve the world. Wabtec has approximately 27,000 employees in facilities throughout the world. Visit the company‚Äôs new website at: http://www.WabtecCorp.com.

It‚Äôs not just about your career‚Ä¶ or your job title‚Ä¶it‚Äôs about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. 3+ years of experience in finance ‚Äì cost control/billings.

Highly motivated and proactive attitude with flexibility to respond to critical questions and challenging situations.

Optimize processes, automate routines, flexibility and openness to continuous improvement.

Critical thinking and detailed-driven profile.

Advanced level knowledge in Microsoft Excel

position: Data Center Eng Ops Tech I, DCEO Technician
required_skills: ['An√°lise de causa raiz (RCA)', 'Descomissionamento', 'Event Ticketing', 'Indicadores-chave de desempenho', 'Infraestrutura de data center', 'Passagens a√©reas', 'Root Cause', 'Sistemas de abertura de chamados', 'Solu√ß√£o de problemas t√©cnicos', 'Walkthroughs']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Description

How would you like to be a part of Earth‚Äôs most customer-centric company? You would work with teams of front-line responders who support the operations of some of the world‚Äôs most powerful data centers. Our Data Center Engineering Operations team maintain and operate our critical infrastructure systems so that they are prepared to stand up against any situation.

AWS has the world‚Äôs largest cloud computing portfolio. As an Amazonian you will work in some of the most sophisticated, safe, and secure data centers in the world. Our Engineering Operations Technicians I (EOT‚Äôs) help keep them that way by working with the brightest minds from around the globe to help test and implement the newest technology and work practices to meet the demands of a changing market.

We have a passion for learning and evolving, it‚Äôs how we have helped define ourselves as leaders in the industry. Let‚Äôs work hard, have fun, and make history!

Key job responsibilities
Maintain the critical data center infrastructure ensuring 99.999% uptime of the world's largest cloud computing portfolio.
Ensure that security procedures are followed.
Monitor the performance of operations and maintenance of electrical, mechanical and fire/safety equipment within the data center.
Provide key performance indicators to senior engineers.
Assist in facility troubleshooting and rack level events respecting Internal Service Level Agreements (SLA).
Work on projects of moderate complexity.
Perform rack installation, rack decommissioning, walkthroughs and other critical facility infrastructure related activities.
Accompany vendors on site, ensuring that all work performed is in accordance with established practices, procedures and local legislation.
Work on basic support such as ticketing systems, root cause analysis, change management processes, and creating/revising operational procedures.
A day in the life

required_skills: ['AWS Lambda', 'Amazon S3', 'Amazon Web Services', 'Automa√ß√£o de testes', 'Docker', 'Estudos de casos', 'Integra√ß√£o e entrega cont√≠nuas (CI/CD)', 'Node.js', 'Planejamento de testes', 'React.js']
description:
Sobre a vaga
About the role
ReMatter is looking for a QA Engineer to help us build modern software solutions for the industrial scrap recycling industry. In this role, your contributions will increase the sustainability of the metal supply chain and increase the efficiency of its transportation and logistics, reducing carbon emissions.
As a QA engineer at ReMatter, you will:
design, develop, and execute automation scripts using open-source tools like Cypress, Playwright, etc.
identify, record, document thoroughly, and track bugs
perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved
liaise with internal teams (e.g., developers and product managers) to identify system requirements
monitor debugging process results
track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts
stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies
understand how to deploy the projects you work on to production environments
contribute to the culture of the company from the ground up alongside the founders and other early team members
uphold our high engineering standards and bring consistency to the codebases, infrastructure, and processes you will encounter

Scrap Metal Recycling is a unique industry. You will need to put in significant time to learn about this industry in order to truly understand our unique customer persona and build a compelling product.

Competencies
This role requires:
strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes
experience in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases
hands-on experience with automated testing tools
excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to articulate technical concepts clearly and succinctly
knowledge in parts of our stack is a plus, but not required. We most frequently work with TypeScript, React, Node, and GraphQL. We run on AWS, and most often deal with Lambda, Cognito, S3, & RDS. We have a robust CI/CD system on GitHub Actions & Docker.

Engineering At ReMatter
We work in an environment where it matters to make the right design decisions the first time, and as a result, take on less technical debt than other companies.
We'd rather have one strong, well-compensated engineer, instead of having 5 average engineers. Our customers are fine with fewer features but are not ok with broken features.
We believe in autonomy and accountability - our team consists of amazing people, eager to learn, teach, and constantly improve our way of working.
People have a strong sense of ownership and accountability for what they‚Äôre building. What we build today will be the foundation for dozens of other systems in the future.
We are very frank in discussing technical matters. If one disagrees with how things are being done, we encourage them to speak up and help us get to the truth faster.

Benefits
Competitive salary and meaningful equity
Learning & Development stipend
Flexible working schedule and vacation policy, Remote/WFH policy
Company events (Hack Weeks, All Hands, weekly social events) and friends and family events

About ReMatter
ReMatter builds digital tools for the $100B+ a year scrap metal recycling industry. Despite the incredible hardware and materials expertise in the industry, scrap software has not kept pace with technological growth.

We create products that meaningfully impact the lives of recyclers by making the process of managing their business easier and more accurate. Additionally, our data-driven pricing and digital payments can drive revenue and streamline the buying and selling of commodities.

ReMatter was co-founded by three Forbes 30 Under 30 Stanford University graduates in March 2020. We are backed by leading Silicon Valley investors, including Founders Fund, AME Cloud Ventures, and 49ers Enterprises.

ReMatter is an Equal Opportunity Employer. ReMatter‚Äôs employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status.

Come and join us!

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

Infosys Brazil is looking for professionals with the Snowflake Developer profile.

Job Description

This professional will play a key role in engaging with the business and functional team in providing the most appropriate technical solutions, in compliance with the client's and Infosys' development standards. It will also support knowledge transfer with the aim of providing value-added solutions that enable our customers to meet the ever-changing needs of the global landscape.

Required Qualifications

Experience in SQL or PL/SQL is required. Expertise in database handling languages (SQL and variants)
Certification in Snowflake ( Preferred )
Hands on experience on at least one large scale Data-warehouse Migration to AWS/Azure Cloud
Experience with Native Cloud Databases
Hands on experience on Snowflake DB and Development experience on Snowsql/Snowpipe , task , streams , containers creations and management, Procedures etc.
Knowledge on structured/ semi structure/ unstructured data set .
Knowledge of (or ability to learn) how metrics might translate or should be altered in Snowflake solution to manage the right events
Knowledge of other programming languages and ability to write code (e.g., VBA, python, XML, R) is preferrable .
Expert in data modeling (physical and logical), ER diagrams, data dictionary, data map, normalize/de-normalize, agile data modeling
Nice to have knowledge in data manipulation tools such as: SSMS, SSIS, Access, Excel, Info Steward, Data Services

Main Activities And Responsibilities

Developing and maintaining data architecture and data models
Create standardized procedures for data flows
Conduct efficient data integration with other third-party tools and Snowflake
Create and maintain the documentation of the architecture, data models and maintenance activities
Review and audit existing data models and solutions and propose better processes
Perform tuning, testing and problem analysis
Identify, design, implement and deploy new Snowflake based data architecture
Automate manual processes and optimize the data flows
Collaborate with the data science experts, BI developers and analysts to create custom data models and integrations with Snowflake
Maintain optimal data pipeline with ETL tools
Resolve production issues to ensure seamless data processing
Additional Information

Type of work: CLT , Flexible hours and hybrid format (face-to-face and remote)
Benefit package: Transportation Voucher, Meal Voucher, Day Care Assistance, Life Insurance, Funeral Assistance, Medical and Dental Insurance,
Career: Global performance in national and international clients and/or projects, possibility of moving in an international career.
Development: Infosys Global Education Center is the largest corporate university in the world, we provide more than 80,000 titles of internal training, in addition to courses and certifications with approved partners (Microsoft, Google, Amazon and SAP), free of charge for all our professionals.
About Us

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

Infosys is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, spouse of protected veteran, or disability.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Description

How would you like to be a part of Earth‚Äôs most customer-centric company? You would work with teams of front-line responders who support the operations of some of the world‚Äôs most powerful data centers. Our Data Center Engineering Operations team maintain and operate our critical infrastructure systems so that they are prepared to stand up against any situation.

AWS has the world‚Äôs largest cloud computing portfolio. As an Amazonian you will work in some of the most sophisticated, safe, and secure data centers in the world. Our Engineering Operations Technicians I (EOT‚Äôs) help keep them that way by working with the brightest minds from around the globe to help test and implement the newest technology and work practices to meet the demands of a changing market.

We have a passion for learning and evolving, it‚Äôs how we have helped define ourselves as leaders in the industry. Let‚Äôs work hard, have fun, and make history!

Key job responsibilities
Maintain the critical data center infrastructure ensuring 99.999% uptime of the world's largest cloud computing portfolio.
Ensure that security procedures are followed.
Monitor the performance of operations and maintenance of electrical, mechanical and fire/safety equipment within the data center.
Provide key performance indicators to senior engineers.
Assist in facility troubleshooting and rack level events respecting Internal Service Level Agreements (SLA).
Work on projects of moderate complexity.
Perform rack installation, rack decommissioning, walkthroughs and other critical facility infrastructure related activities.
Accompany vendors on site, ensuring that all work performed is in accordance with established practices, procedures and local legislation.
Work on basic support such as ticketing systems, root cause analysis, change management processes, and creating/revising operational procedures.
A day in the life
Work on foot on uneven terrain. Maintain balance and perform tasks using a ladder.
Regularly lift and/or move up to 18Kg alone or in a group for 18Kg+.
Regularly walk, use hands and fingers, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, climb up and down stairs, bend, work above the shoulders, grasp, carry, push and pull.

Basic Qualifications
Electrical/Mechanical Technical High school or Bachelor in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering or related area.
Advanced English: read/write/speak.
Preferred Qualifications
Relevant experience in data centers or mission critical facilities (e.g. hospital, military facility, public safety facility, etc.).

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

If you‚Äôve ever used an ATM, paid a bill through your phone, sent money to a friend or shopped online, chances are your transaction was safeguarded and processed using our software. Now it‚Äôs your turn to serve the payment needs of organizations and people the world over.

As a Technical Consultant in S√£o Paulo (Brazil) / Bogot√° (Colombia) you will join a diverse, passionate team, dedicated to making possibilities happen in the payments industry!

Join the Team Making Possibilities Happen

If you‚Äôve ever used an ATM, paid a bill through your phone, sent money to a friend or shopped online, chances are your transaction was safeguarded and processed using our software. Now it‚Äôs your turn to serve the payment needs of organizations and people the world over.

Job Summary:

Ensures new and existing ACI customers receive a first class delivery service in accordance with customer expectations and contractual agreements. Primarily responsible for the identification/development of solutions for customers using company products, outsourced solutions and/or proprietary tools/techniques implemented by others. Defines customer needs and develops a plan and proposal for delivery of the project. Viewed by customers as a consultant. Performance is typically evaluated based on utilization, (i.e., billable hours).

Job Responsibilities:

Analyzes client‚Äôs business needs, integrates client‚Äôs business strategies and recommends appropriate information technology solutions utilizing ACI‚Äôs methodologies. Conducts analysis of corporate objectives, business functions and processes. Fully understands the customer‚Äôs functional and technical requirements and is involved in the specification of these.
Provides analysis, consultation and advice to project delivery associates on all technical aspects of the engagement. Recommends and implements process improvements.
Supports the regional/product‚Äôs business development and sales support efforts for a particular territory, industry or account.
Assists customer with implementation efforts as necessary to ensure successful product adoption.
Anticipates the implications and consequences of risks or business situations and take appropriate action to prepare for possible mitigation actions and or contingencies. Identifies information needed to clarify a risk or business situation, seeks that information from appropriate
sources and uses skillful questioning to draw out the information.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Understand and adhere to all corporate policies to include but not limited to the ACI Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience required for the job:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience.
2 years relevant experience.
Some Unix/Linux experience.
Some SQL experience.
Payments experience preferred.

Preferred Knowledge, Skills and Experience needed for the job:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems/Management, Business, or Finance.

Benefits: In return for your expertise, we offer growth, opportunity, and a competitive compensation and benefits package in a casual work environment.

Are you ready to help us transform the world of electronic payments? To learn more about ACI Worldwide, visit our web site at www.aciworldwide.com

ACI Worldwide is an AA/EEO employer in the United States, which includes providing equal opportunity for protected veterans and individuals with disabilities, and an EEO employer globally
